pageContext.claim: “If I would have said this on the campaign trail, if I would have used 4.2%, you saw it was adjusted upward from 4.1%, 4.2% GDP, the press would have gone after me, they would have said impossible.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump touts the second quarter GDP growth of 4.2 percent, suggesting the figure was unheard of being he took office. Most recently, GDP growth hit 5.2 percent in the third quarter of 2014 while Obama was still in office. Moreover, he regularly promised 4 percent annual growth when he campaigned for president.
